snippet: Desperate about a decline in the quality of public education, California voters on Tuesday will be faced with a proposal for a dramatic change that would plunge them into the unknown and offer them little chance of retreat.   The proposal is a no-...
lead_paragraph: Desperate about a decline in the quality of public education, California voters on Tuesday will be faced with a proposal for a dramatic change that would plunge them into the unknown and offer them little chance of retreat. The proposal is a no-holds-barred version of an idea that has slowly been gaining ground with a mix of constituencies who seek an overhaul of the educational system: state-financed vouchers that parents could use to help pay for private schooling.

headline.main: Upset With Quality of Schools, Californians Will Vote on Voucher Proposal
